response.output:
## Case Title
AI CV & Job Application Assistant

## Background
Students and recent graduates (like Emily, the ambitious graduate persona) frequently struggle to tailor their CVs and cover letters for each specific job application. This crucial process is often time-consuming, tedious, and a significant source of anxiety, requiring a deep understanding of how to highlight relevant skills and navigate Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS). An AI-powered tool can automate and optimize this process, providing substantial time savings (45 minutes to 1.5 hours per application), increasing user confidence, and reducing stress. This also offers a realistic experience of how AI is used in modern recruitment, empowering users to navigate the competitive job market more efficiently and effectively.

## Purpose
The primary purpose of this application is to help students create customized, high-quality job applications. It will analyze a user's CV against a specific job advertisement to generate a tailored cover letter, suggest improvements to the CV, and identify any missing qualifications.

## Target Users
The primary target users are students and recent graduates (0-3 years post-graduation) actively seeking entry-level or early-career professional roles. Our core persona is **Emily, The Ambitious Graduate** (age 22-24, high tech-savvy), who seeks to secure her first full-time role, stand out in a competitive market, and efficiently create compelling application documents.

## Core Functionality
The core features are focused on analyzing user documents and generating optimized application materials.

### Must Have (MVP)
- Feature 1: Enhanced Document Upload: Users can upload their CV in various formats (PDF, DOC, TXT) and paste the text of a job advertisement. This includes dedicated drag-and-drop zones with clear feedback for intuitive UX.
- Feature 2: Cover Letter Generation: The system generates a customized cover letter based on the user's CV and the job description, allowing the user to specify a desired tone and style using curated style presets.
- Feature 3: Categorized CV Improvement Suggestions: The application analyzes the CV and provides concrete, categorized suggestions for improvements to better match the job requirements, presented in an organized and actionable format.

### Nice to Have (Optional Extensions)
- Feature 4: Gap Analysis: The tool provides a detailed analysis of missing qualifications and skills (a "gap analysis") by comparing the CV to the job ad.
- Feature 5: ATS Optimization Score: The system gives feedback on how well the CV is optimized for Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and suggests keyword improvements.
- Feature 6: Multi-language Support: Ability to process documents and generate outputs in different languages.

## User-Centric Opportunities (Future Enhancements)
Based on user research, the following opportunities are identified for future enhancements to further empower users:

- **Hyper-Personalized Application Generation:** AI learns user style and preferences to generate even more authentic and personalized application documents.
- **Proactive Skill Gap Identification & Targeted Learning Recommendations:** The AI identifies skill gaps based on desired roles and suggests specific learning resources or courses.
- **Integrated Application Management & Insights:** Provides simple analytics and tracking for applications, offering users insights into their job search effectiveness.
- **Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts:** Generates common interview questions based on the job ad and the user's CV, aiding in interview preparation.

## Data Requirements
The system needs to manage user-specific information and the documents they upload and generate.

- Data entity 1: Users: User ID, email, encrypted password, and other profile information.
- Data entity 2: CVs/Documents: Storage for uploaded documents like CVs and past applications, linked to a specific user. Encrypted storage is required.
- Data entity 3: Job Applications: Data related to each application session, including the pasted job ad, user inputs (keywords, tone), and the generated documents (cover letter, analysis reports).

## User Stories (Optional)

1. As a student, I want to upload my CV and a job ad, so that I can get a tailored cover letter automatically.
2. As a job applicant, I want to receive suggestions on how to improve my CV, so that it better matches the job I'm applying for.
3. As a user, I want to create a secure account, so that I can save my documents and track my applications over time.

## Technical Constraints
The project has specific technical and security requirements.

- User Authentication: A secure login system is mandatory to protect personal data and documents.
- Responsive design: The application must be responsive to work on PC. mobiles and tablets, as many users probably is using their mobile device.
- File Handling: The application must be able to process different file formats for CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT).

## Success Criteria
The success of the project will be measured by its core functionalities and user impact.

- Criterion 1: Successful Document Generation: Users can successfully upload their CV and a job description and receive a relevant, well-written cover letter, demonstrating high relevance and quality.
- Criterion 2: Actionable Feedback: The CV improvement suggestions are clear, relevant, helpful, and easily actionable by the user, leading to measurable improvements in application quality.
- Criterion 3: Secure and Intuitive User Experience: User data is securely stored, and users can log in to access their previous sessions and documents with an intuitive and transparent interface that builds trust.
- Criterion 4: Time Savings & Confidence Boost: The tool demonstrably saves users significant time per application and increases their confidence in the application process.

# Product Brief: ibe160

**Date:** 2025-10-29
**Author:** BIP
**Status:** Draft for PM Review

---

## Executive Summary

{{executive_summary}}

---

## Problem Statement

Students and recent graduates frequently struggle with the time-consuming, tedious, and anxiety-inducing process of tailoring their CVs and cover letters for each job application. This manual effort makes it difficult to consistently highlight relevant skills and effectively navigate Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), creating a significant barrier to success in a competitive job market.

---

## Proposed Solution

An AI-powered "CV & Job Application Assistant" that automates and optimizes the application process. The tool will analyze a user's CV against a specific job advertisement to:
1.  **Generate a tailored cover letter** with a user-specified tone and style.
2.  **Provide categorized, actionable suggestions** for improving the CV to better match the job requirements.
3.  **Offer an intuitive document upload experience** to streamline the process.

This solution will empower users to create high-quality, customized applications with significant time savings and increased confidence.

---

## Target Users

### Primary User Segment

Students and recent graduates (0-3 years post-graduation) actively seeking entry-level or early-career professional roles. Our core persona is **Emily, The Ambitious Graduate** (age 22-24, high tech-savvy), who is motivated to secure her first full-time role and stand out in a competitive market.

### Secondary User Segment

Early career professionals (1-3 years experience) seeking to transition to a new role or industry and looking for tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their job search.

---

## Goals and Success Metrics

### Business Objectives

-   Successfully launch the MVP of the AI CV & Job Application Assistant.
-   Achieve a high level of user satisfaction and engagement.
-   Establish a foundation for future enhancements and monetization.

### User Success Metrics

-   **Time Savings:** Users save a significant amount of time (target: >30 minutes) per application.
-   **Increased Confidence:** Users report a measurable increase in confidence in their job applications.
-   **Improved Application Quality:** Users can create higher quality, more relevant application documents.

### Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

-   Number of active users.
-   Number of applications processed.
-   User satisfaction score (e.g., NPS or CSAT).
-   Adoption rate of core features (cover letter generation, CV suggestions).

---

## Strategic Alignment and Financial Impact

### Financial Impact

{{financial_impact}}

### Company Objectives Alignment

{{company_objectives_alignment}}

### Strategic Initiatives

{{strategic_initiatives}}

---

## MVP Scope

### Core Features (Must Have)

-   **Enhanced Document Upload:** Intuitive drag-and-drop interface for uploading CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT) and pasting job ad text.
-   **Cover Letter Generation:** AI-powered generation of tailored cover letters with curated style presets.
-   **Categorized CV Improvement Suggestions:** Actionable, organized feedback to help users improve their CVs for specific jobs.

### Out of Scope for MVP

-   Gap Analysis (detailed analysis of missing qualifications).
-   ATS Optimization Score.
-   Multi-language Support.
-   Hyper-Personalized Application Generation.
-   Proactive Skill Gap Identification.
-   Integrated Application Management & Insights.
-   Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts.

### MVP Success Criteria

-   Users can successfully generate a relevant and high-quality cover letter.
-   The CV improvement suggestions are clear, helpful, and actionable.
-   The user interface is intuitive and builds user trust.
-   The system securely handles user data and sessions.

---

## Post-MVP Vision

### Phase 2 Features

-   **Gap Analysis:** Detailed analysis of missing qualifications and skills.
-   **ATS Optimization Score:** Feedback on how well the CV is optimized for Applicant Tracking Systems.
-   **Multi-language Support:** Ability to process documents and generate outputs in different languages.
-   **Integrated Application Management & Insights:** Simple analytics and tracking for applications.

### Long-term Vision

-   **Hyper-Personalized Application Generation:** An AI that learns user style and preferences to generate more authentic documents.
-   **Proactive Skill Gap Identification & Targeted Learning Recommendations:** An AI that identifies skill gaps and suggests learning resources.
-   **Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts:** AI-generated interview questions based on the job ad and CV.

### Expansion Opportunities

-   Integrations with job boards and professional networking platforms.
-   Partnerships with universities and career services organizations.
-   Development of a B2B offering for recruitment agencies or HR departments.

---

## Technical Considerations

### Platform Requirements

-   The application must be a responsive web application, accessible on PC, mobile, and tablet devices.

### Technology Preferences

-   A secure login system is mandatory to protect user data.
-   The backend must be capable of processing different file formats for CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT).
-   The AI model for text generation and analysis should be chosen for its accuracy and efficiency.

### Architecture Considerations

-   A scalable architecture is required to handle a growing number of users and documents.
-   Data storage for user information and documents must be encrypted and secure.
-   The application should be designed for high availability and reliability.

# Product Brief: ibe160

**Date:** 2025-10-29
**Author:** BIP
**Status:** Draft for PM Review

---

## Executive Summary

The "AI CV & Job Application Assistant" is a tool designed to empower students and recent graduates in the competitive job market. By automating the tedious process of tailoring CVs and cover letters, the application saves users significant time, boosts their confidence, and improves the quality of their job applications. The MVP will focus on core features like cover letter generation and CV improvement suggestions, with a long-term vision to become a comprehensive career co-pilot.

---

## Problem Statement

Students and recent graduates frequently struggle with the time-consuming, tedious, and anxiety-inducing process of tailoring their CVs and cover letters for each job application. This manual effort makes it difficult to consistently highlight relevant skills and effectively navigate Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), creating a significant barrier to success in a competitive job market.

---

## Proposed Solution

An AI-powered "CV & Job Application Assistant" that automates and optimizes the application process. The tool will analyze a user's CV against a specific job advertisement to:
1.  **Generate a tailored cover letter** with a user-specified tone and style.
2.  **Provide categorized, actionable suggestions** for improving the CV to better match the job requirements.
3.  **Offer an intuitive document upload experience** to streamline the process.

This solution will empower users to create high-quality, customized applications with significant time savings and increased confidence.

---

## Target Users

### Primary User Segment

Students and recent graduates (0-3 years post-graduation) actively seeking entry-level or early-career professional roles. Our core persona is **Emily, The Ambitious Graduate** (age 22-24, high tech-savvy), who is motivated to secure her first full-time role and stand out in a competitive market.

### Secondary User Segment

Early career professionals (1-3 years experience) seeking to transition to a new role or industry and looking for tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their job search.

---

## Goals and Success Metrics

### Business Objectives

-   Successfully launch the MVP of the AI CV & Job Application Assistant.
-   Achieve a high level of user satisfaction and engagement.
-   Establish a foundation for future enhancements and monetization.

### User Success Metrics

-   **Time Savings:** Users save a significant amount of time (target: >30 minutes) per application.
-   **Increased Confidence:** Users report a measurable increase in confidence in their job applications.
-   **Improved Application Quality:** Users can create higher quality, more relevant application documents.

### Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

-   Number of active users.
-   Number of applications processed.
-   User satisfaction score (e.g., NPS or CSAT).
-   Adoption rate of core features (cover letter generation, CV suggestions).

---

## Strategic Alignment and Financial Impact

### Financial Impact

The project is expected to have a positive financial impact through a future subscription-based model. The initial focus is on user acquisition and engagement.

### Company Objectives Alignment

This project aligns with the company's objective of leveraging AI to create innovative solutions that address real-world user needs.

### Strategic Initiatives

This project supports the strategic initiative of expanding into the EdTech and career development market.

---

## MVP Scope

### Core Features (Must Have)

-   **Enhanced Document Upload:** Intuitive drag-and-drop interface for uploading CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT) and pasting job ad text.
-   **Cover Letter Generation:** AI-powered generation of tailored cover letters with curated style presets.
-   **Categorized CV Improvement Suggestions:** Actionable, organized feedback to help users improve their CVs for specific jobs.

### Out of Scope for MVP

-   Gap Analysis (detailed analysis of missing qualifications).
-   ATS Optimization Score.
-   Multi-language Support.
-   Hyper-Personalized Application Generation.
-   Proactive Skill Gap Identification.
-   Integrated Application Management & Insights.
-   Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts.

### MVP Success Criteria

-   Users can successfully generate a relevant and high-quality cover letter.
-   The CV improvement suggestions are clear, helpful, and actionable.
-   The user interface is intuitive and builds user trust.
-   The system securely handles user data and sessions.

---

## Post-MVP Vision

### Phase 2 Features

-   **Gap Analysis:** Detailed analysis of missing qualifications and skills.
-   **ATS Optimization Score:** Feedback on how well the CV is optimized for Applicant Tracking Systems.
-   **Multi-language Support:** Ability to process documents and generate outputs in different languages.
-   **Integrated Application Management & Insights:** Simple analytics and tracking for applications.

### Long-term Vision

-   **Hyper-Personalized Application Generation:** An AI that learns user style and preferences to generate more authentic documents.
-   **Proactive Skill Gap Identification & Targeted Learning Recommendations:** An AI that identifies skill gaps and suggests learning resources.
-   **Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts:** AI-generated interview questions based on the job ad and CV.

### Expansion Opportunities

-   Integrations with job boards and professional networking platforms.
-   Partnerships with universities and career services organizations.
-   Development of a B2B offering for recruitment agencies or HR departments.

---

## Technical Considerations

### Platform Requirements

-   The application must be a responsive web application, accessible on PC, mobile, and tablet devices.

### Technology Preferences

-   A secure login system is mandatory to protect user data.
-   The backend must be capable of processing different file formats for CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT).
-   The AI model for text generation and analysis should be chosen for its accuracy and efficiency.

### Architecture Considerations

-   A scalable architecture is required to handle a growing number of users and documents.
-   Data storage for user information and documents must be encrypted and secure.
-   The application should be designed for high availability and reliability.

---

## Constraints and Assumptions

### Constraints

-   The application must be responsive and work on PC, mobile, and tablets.
-   A secure login system is mandatory.
-   The system must handle PDF, DOC, and TXT file formats.

### Key Assumptions

-   Users are willing to use an AI-powered tool for their job applications.
-   Users will provide accurate and up-to-date information in their CVs.
-   The chosen AI model will be able to provide high-quality and relevant outputs.

---

## Risks and Open Questions

### Key Risks

-   **Trust & Transparency:** Users may distrust AI-generated content. Mitigation: Provide clear explanations of AI functionality and allow for manual overrides.
-   **Data Privacy:** Users may have concerns about the storage and usage of their personal data. Mitigation: Implement robust security measures and a clear privacy policy.
-   **Over-reliance:** Users may become overly dependent on the AI. Mitigation: Position the tool as an assistant and encourage user review and personalization.

### Open Questions

-   What is the most effective pricing model for this product (freemium vs. subscription)?
-   How can we best measure the impact of the tool on user success in the job market?
-   What are the most important factors for building user trust in an AI-powered career tool?

### Areas Needing Further Research

-   Empirical validation of the feature impact through user testing and surveys.
-   A/B testing of different UI/UX approaches to maximize usability and trust.
-   Exploration of different AI models for text generation and analysis.

---

## Appendices

### A. Research Summary

The user research report ("research-user-2025-10-29.md") provides a detailed analysis of the target user, their pain points, and the market opportunity.

### B. Stakeholder Input

This brief is based on the initial project proposal ("proposal.md") and subsequent discussions.

### C. References

-   proposal.md
-   docs/research-user-2025-10-29.md

---

_This Product Brief serves as the foundational input for Product Requirements Document (PRD) creation._

_Next Steps: Handoff to Product Manager for PRD development using the `workflow prd` command._

--- C:\Users\fredr\OneDrive\Documents\IBE160\SG-Gruppe-5\bmad\bmm\workflows\2-plan-workflows\prd\instructions.md ---

# PRD Workflow Instructions

<critical>The workflow execution engine is governed by: {project-root}/bmad/core/tasks/workflow.xml</critical>
<critical>You MUST have already loaded and processed: {installed_path}/workflow.yaml</critical>
<critical>Communicate all responses in {communication_language} and language MUST be tailored to {user_skill_level}</critical>
<critical>Generate all documents in {document_output_language}</critical>
<critical>This workflow is for Level 2-4 projects. Level 0-1 use tech-spec workflow.</critical>
<critical>Produces TWO outputs: PRD.md (strategic) and epics.md (tactical implementation)</critical>
<critical>TECHNICAL NOTES: If ANY technical details, preferences, or constraints are mentioned during PRD discussions, append them to {technical_decisions_file}. If file doesn't exist, create it from {technical_decisions_template}</critical>

<critical>DOCUMENT OUTPUT: Concise, clear, actionable requirements. Use tables/lists over prose. User skill level ({user_skill_level}) affects conversation style ONLY, not document content.</critical>

<workflow>

<step n="0" goal="Validate workflow readiness" tag="workflow-status">
<action>Check if {output_folder}/bmm-workflow-status.yaml exists</action>

<check if="status file not found">
  <output>No workflow status file found. PRD workflow can run standalone or as part of BMM workflow path.</output>
  <output>**Recommended:** Run `workflow-init` first for project context tracking and workflow sequencing.</output>
  <ask>Continue in standalone mode or exit to run workflow-init? (continue/exit)</ask>
  <check if="continue">
    <action>Set standalone_mode = true</action>
  </check>
  <check if="exit">
    <action>Exit workflow</action>
  </check>
</check>

<check if="status file found">
  <action>Load the FULL file: {output_folder}/bmm-workflow-status.yaml</action>
  <action>Parse workflow_status section</action>
  <action>Check status of "prd" workflow</action>
  <action>Get project_level from YAML metadata</action>
  <action>Find first non-completed workflow (next expected workflow)</action>

  <check if="project_level < 2">
    <output>**Incorrect Workflow for Level {{project_level}}**

PRD is for Level 2-4 projects. Level 0-1 should use tech-spec directly.

**Correct workflow:** `tech-spec` (Architect agent)
</output>
<action>Exit and redirect to tech-spec</action>
</check>

  <check if="prd status is file path (already completed)">
    <output>âš ï¸ PRD already completed: {{prd status}}</output>
    <ask>Re-running will overwrite the existing PRD. Continue? (y/n)</ask>
    <check if="n">
      <output>Exiting. Use workflow-status to see your next step.</output>
      <action>Exit workflow</action>
    </check>
  </check>

  <check if="prd is not the next expected workflow">
    <output>âš ï¸ Next expected workflow: {{next_workflow}}. PRD is out of sequence.</output>
    <ask>Continue with PRD anyway? (y/n)</ask>
    <check if="n">
      <output>Exiting. Run {{next_workflow}} instead.</output>
      <action>Exit workflow</action>
    </check>
  </check>

<action>Set standalone_mode = false</action>
</check>
</step>

<step n="1" goal="Initialize PRD context">

<action>Use {{project_level}} from status data</action>
<action>Check for existing PRD.md in {output_folder}</action>

<check if="PRD.md exists">
  <ask>Found existing PRD.md. Would you like to:
1. Continue where you left off
2. Modify existing sections
3. Start fresh (will archive existing file)
  </ask>
  <action if="option 1">Load existing PRD and skip to first incomplete section</action>
  <action if="option 2">Load PRD and ask which section to modify</action>
  <action if="option 3">Archive existing PRD and start fresh</action>
</check>

<action>Load PRD template: {prd_template}</action>
<action>Load epics template: {epics_template}</action>

<ask>Do you have a Product Brief? (Strongly recommended for Level 3-4, helpful for Level 2)</ask>

<check if="yes">
  <action>Load and review product brief: {output_folder}/product-brief.md</action>
  <action>Extract key elements: problem statement, target users, success metrics, MVP scope, constraints</action>
</check>

<check if="no and level >= 3">
  <warning>Product Brief is strongly recommended for Level 3-4 projects. Consider running the product-brief workflow first.</warning>
  <ask>Continue without Product Brief? (y/n)</ask>
  <action if="no">Exit to allow Product Brief creation</action>
</check>

</step>

<step n="2" goal="Goals and Background Context">

**Goals** - What success looks like for this project

<check if="product brief exists">
  <action>Review goals from product brief and refine for PRD context</action>
</check>

<check if="no product brief">
  <action>Gather goals through discussion with user, use probing questions and converse until you are ready to propose that you have enough information to proceed</action>
</check>

Create a bullet list of single-line desired outcomes that capture user and project goals.

**Scale guidance:**

- Level 2: 2-3 core goals
- Level 3: 3-5 strategic goals
- Level 4: 5-7 comprehensive goals

<template-output>goals</template-output>

**Background Context** - Why this matters now

<check if="product brief exists">
  <action>Summarize key context from brief without redundancy</action>
</check>

<check if="no product brief">
  <action>Gather context through discussion</action>
</check>

Write 1-2 paragraphs covering:

- What problem this solves and why
- Current landscape or need
- Key insights from discovery/brief (if available)

<template-output>background_context</template-output>

</step>

<step n="3" goal="Requirements - Functional and Non-Functional">

**Functional Requirements** - What the system must do

Draft functional requirements as numbered items with FR prefix.

**Scale guidance:**

- Level 2: 8-15 FRs (focused MVP set)
- Level 3: 12-25 FRs (comprehensive product)
- Level 4: 20-35 FRs (enterprise platform)

**Format:**

- FR001: [Clear capability statement]
- FR002: [Another capability]

**Focus on:**

- User-facing capabilities
- Core system behaviors
- Integration requirements
- Data management needs

Group related requirements logically.

<invoke-task halt="true">{project-root}/bmad/core/tasks/adv-elicit.xml</invoke-task>

<template-output>functional_requirements</template-output>

**Non-Functional Requirements** - How the system must perform

Draft non-functional requirements with NFR prefix.

**Scale guidance:**

- Level 2: 1-3 NFRs (critical MVP only)
- Level 3: 2-5 NFRs (production quality)
- Level 4: 3-7+ NFRs (enterprise grade)

<template-output>non_functional_requirements</template-output>

</step>

<step n="4" goal="User Journeys - scale-adaptive" optional="level == 2">

**Journey Guidelines (scale-adaptive):**

- **Level 2:** 1 simple journey (primary use case happy path)
- **Level 3:** 2-3 detailed journeys (complete flows with decision points)
- **Level 4:** 3-5 comprehensive journeys (all personas and edge cases)

<check if="level == 2">
  <ask>Would you like to document a user journey for the primary use case? (recommended but optional)</ask>
  <check if="yes">
    Create 1 simple journey showing the happy path.
  </check>
</check>

<check if="level >= 3">
  Map complete user flows with decision points, alternatives, and edge cases.
</check>

<template-output>user_journeys</template-output>

<check if="level >= 3">
  <invoke-task halt="true">{project-root}/bmad/core/tasks/adv-elicit.xml</invoke-task>
</check>

</step>

<step n="5" goal="UX and UI Vision - high-level overview" optional="level == 2 and minimal UI">

**Purpose:** Capture essential UX/UI information needed for epic and story planning. A dedicated UX workflow will provide deeper design detail later.

<check if="level == 2 and minimal UI">
  <action>For backend-heavy or minimal UI projects, keep this section very brief or skip</action>
</check>

**Gather high-level UX/UI information:**

1. **UX Principles** (2-4 key principles that guide design decisions)
   - What core experience qualities matter most?
   - Any critical accessibility or usability requirements?

2. **Platform & Screens**
   - Target platforms (web, mobile, desktop)
   - Core screens/views users will interact with
   - Key interaction patterns or navigation approach

3. **Design Constraints**
   - Existing design systems or brand guidelines
   - Technical UI constraints (browser support, etc.)

<note>Keep responses high-level. Detailed UX planning happens in the UX workflow after PRD completion.</note>

<invoke-task halt="true">{project-root}/bmad/core/tasks/adv-elicit.xml</invoke-task>

<template-output>ux_principles</template-output>
<template-output>ui_design_goals</template-output>

</step>

<step n="6" goal="Epic List - High-level delivery sequence">

**Epic Structure** - Major delivery milestones

Create high-level epic list showing logical delivery sequence.

**Epic Sequencing Rules:**

1. **Epic 1 MUST establish foundation**
   - Project infrastructure (repo, CI/CD, core setup)
   - Initial deployable functionality
   - Development workflow established
   - Exception: If adding to existing app, Epic 1 can be first major feature

2. **Subsequent Epics:**
   - Each delivers significant, end-to-end, fully deployable increment
   - Build upon previous epics (no forward dependencies)
   - Represent major functional blocks
   - Prefer fewer, larger epics over fragmentation

**Scale guidance:**

- Level 2: 1-2 epics, 5-15 stories total
- Level 3: 2-5 epics, 15-40 stories total
- Level 4: 5-10 epics, 40-100+ stories total

**For each epic provide:**

- Epic number and title
- Single-sentence goal statement
- Estimated story count

**Example:**

- **Epic 1: Project Foundation & User Authentication**
- **Epic 2: Core Task Management**

<ask>Review the epic list. Does the sequence make sense? Any epics to add, remove, or resequence?</ask>
<action>Refine epic list based on feedback</action>
<invoke-task halt="true">{project-root}/bmad/core/tasks/adv-elicit.xml</invoke-task>

<template-output>epic_list</template-output>

</step>

<step n="7" goal="Out of Scope - Clear boundaries and future additions">

**Out of Scope** - What we're NOT doing (now)

Document what is explicitly excluded from this project:

- Features/capabilities deferred to future phases
- Adjacent problems not being solved
- Integrations or platforms not supported
- Scope boundaries that need clarification

This helps prevent scope creep and sets clear expectations.

<template-output>out_of_scope</template-output>

</step>

<step n="8" goal="Finalize PRD.md">

<action>Review all PRD sections for completeness and consistency</action>
<action>Ensure all placeholders are filled</action>
<action>Save final PRD.md to {default_output_file}</action>

**PRD.md is complete!** Strategic document ready.

Now we'll create the tactical implementation guide in epics.md.

</step>

<step n="9" goal="Epic Details - Full story breakdown in epics.md">

<critical>Now we create epics.md - the tactical implementation roadmap</critical>
<critical>This is a SEPARATE FILE from PRD.md</critical>

<action>Load epics template: {epics_template}</action>
<action>Initialize epics.md with project metadata</action>

For each epic from the epic list, expand with full story details:

**Epic Expansion Process:**

1. **Expanded Goal** (2-3 sentences)
   - Describe the epic's objective and value delivery
   - Explain how it builds on previous work

2. **Story Breakdown**

   **Critical Story Requirements:**
   - **Vertical slices** - Each story delivers complete, testable functionality
   - **Sequential** - Stories must be logically ordered within epic
   - **No forward dependencies** - No story depends on work from a later story/epic
   - **AI-agent sized** - Completable in single focused session (2-4 hours)
   - **Value-focused** - Minimize pure enabler stories; integrate technical work into value delivery

   **Story Format:**

   ```
   **Story [EPIC.N]: [Story Title]**

   As a [user type],
   I want [goal/desire],
   So that [benefit/value].

   **Acceptance Criteria:**
   1. [Specific testable criterion]
   2. [Another specific criterion]
   3. [etc.]

   **Prerequisites:** [Any dependencies on previous stories]
   ```

3. **Story Sequencing Within Epic:**
   - Start with foundational/setup work if needed
   - Build progressively toward epic goal
   - Each story should leave system in working state
   - Final stories complete the epic's value delivery

**Process each epic:**

<repeat for-each="epic in epic_list">

<ask>Ready to break down {{epic_title}}? (y/n)</ask>

<action>Discuss epic scope and story ideas with user</action>
<action>Draft story list ensuring vertical slices and proper sequencing</action>
<action>For each story, write user story format and acceptance criteria</action>
<action>Verify no forward dependencies exist</action>

<template-output file="epics.md">{{epic_title}}\_details</template-output>

<ask>Review {{epic_title}} stories. Any adjustments needed?</ask>

<action if="yes">Refine stories based on feedback</action>

</repeat>

<action>Save complete epics.md to {epics_output_file}</action>

**Epic Details complete!** Implementation roadmap ready.

</step>

<step n="10" goal="Update status and complete" tag="workflow-status">

<check if="standalone_mode != true">
  <action>Load the FULL file: {output_folder}/bmm-workflow-status.yaml</action>
  <action>Find workflow_status key "prd"</action>
  <critical>ONLY write the file path as the status value - no other text, notes, or metadata</critical>
  <action>Update workflow_status["prd"] = "{default_output_file}"</action>
  <action>Save file, preserving ALL comments and structure including STATUS DEFINITIONS</action>

<action>Find first non-completed workflow in workflow_status (next workflow to do)</action>
<action>Determine next agent from path file based on next workflow</action>
</check>

<output>**âœ… PRD Workflow Complete, {user_name}!**

**Deliverables Created:**

1. âœ… bmm-PRD.md - Strategic product requirements document
2. âœ… bmm-epics.md - Tactical implementation roadmap with story breakdown

**Next Steps:**

- **Next required:** {{next_workflow}} ({{next_agent}} agent)
- **Optional:** Review PRD and epics with stakeholders, or run `create-design` if you have UI requirements

Check status anytime with: `workflow-status`

Would you like to:

1. Review/refine any section
2. Proceed to next phase
3. Exit and review documents
   </output>

</step>

</workflow>

# Product Requirements Document (PRD) Workflow
name: prd
description: "Unified PRD workflow for project levels 2-4. Produces strategic PRD and tactical epic breakdown. Hands off to architecture workflow for technical design. Note: Level 0-1 use tech-spec workflow."
author: "BMad"

# Critical variables from config
config_source: "{project-root}/bmad/bmm/config.yaml"
project_name: "{config_source}:project_name"
output_folder: "{config_source}:output_folder"
user_name: "{config_source}:user_name"
communication_language: "{config_source}:communication_language"
document_output_language: "{config_source}:document_output_language"
user_skill_level: "{config_source}:user_skill_level"
date: system-generated

# Workflow components
installed_path: "{project-root}/bmad/bmm/workflows/2-plan-workflows/prd"
instructions: "{installed_path}/instructions.md"

# Templates
prd_template: "{installed_path}/prd-template.md"
epics_template: "{installed_path}/epics-template.md"

# Output files
status_file: "{output_folder}/bmm-workflow-status.md"
default_output_file: "{output_folder}/PRD.md"
epics_output_file: "{output_folder}/epics.md"
technical_decisions_file: "{output_folder}/technical-decisions.md"
technical_decisions_template: "{project-root}/bmad/bmm/_module-installer/assets/technical-decisions.md"

# Recommended input documents
recommended_inputs:
  - product_brief: "{output_folder}/product-brief.md"
  - market_research: "{output_folder}/market-research.md"

standalone: true
--- End of content ---

"PRD" stands for **Product Requirements Document**. It's a comprehensive workflow designed for medium to large-scale projects (Level 2-4).

Its main purpose is to define:
*   **What** the product is (goals, requirements, user experience).
*   **How** it will be built (high-level epics and detailed story breakdowns for implementation).

The workflow generates two key documents:
1.  `PRD.md`: A strategic document outlining the product's overall requirements.
2.  `epics.md`: A tactical roadmap detailing the implementation plan with user stories.

It's typically managed by a Project Manager (`pm` agent) and helps ensure clear communication and planning before development begins.

# User Research Report: AI CV & Job Application Assistant

**Date:** 2025-10-29
**Prepared by:** BIP
**Research Depth:** Standard analysis (4-6 hours)

---

## Executive Summary

The core opportunity for the "AI CV & Job Application Assistant" is to empower students and recent graduates (like Emily) to navigate the complex and competitive job market with confidence and efficiency. This is achieved by providing an intelligent AI assistant that automates and optimizes the tedious, time-consuming, and often anxiety-inducing process of tailoring job applications.

### Key User Value & Impact

-   **Time Savings:** Estimated 45 minutes to 1.5 hours saved per application.
-   **Increased Confidence:** Users feel more confident in optimized, competitive applications.
-   **Reduced Stress/Anxiety:** Alleviates the burden of manual tailoring and ATS worries.
-   **Improved Quality:** Higher relevance, ATS optimization, and better articulation in documents.

### Critical Success Factors

-   **Prioritize Intuitive UX for Core Inputs:** The enhanced drag-and-drop functionality for document upload is crucial.
-   **Focus on Actionable AI Output:** Implement categorized CV suggestions and cover letter style presets.
-   **Build Trust through Transparency & Editability:** Ensure AI suggestions are clearly explained, and users can easily review and modify generated content.
-   **Integrate Simple Tracking:** Basic application tracking tags add significant organizational value and a sense of control for the user.

---

## 1. Research Objectives and Methodology

### Research Objectives

-   Understand user pain points and current methods for tailoring job applications.
-   Validate core functionality ideas (Document Upload, Cover Letter Generation, CV Improvement Suggestions) from a user perspective.
-   Develop initial user personas and map basic user journeys.

### Scope and Boundaries

-   **Product/Service:** AI CV & Job Application Assistant - an AI-powered tool to help students and recent graduates create customized, high-quality job applications by analyzing their CV against job ads to generate tailored cover letters and suggest CV improvements.
-   **User Context:**
    *   **Primary Category:** Job Application Assistance / Career Development Tools.
    *   **Adjacent Markets:** AI Writing Assistants, Resume Builders, Job Boards, Educational Technology (EdTech).
-   **Geographic Scope:** Users in regions where English is the primary language for professional communication.
-   **Customer Segments:** B2C - Students and recent graduates (0-3 years post-graduation) actively seeking entry-level or early-career professional roles.

### Research Methodology

This user research was conducted through a structured, iterative process involving:
1.  **Persona Creation:** Developing a detailed profile of the primary target user.
2.  **Jobs-to-be-Done (JTBD) Analysis:** Identifying the functional, emotional, and social needs driving user behavior.
3.  **Willingness to Pay Analysis:** Estimating user price sensitivity and perceived value.
4.  **Alternatives Analysis:** Understanding current user solutions and their limitations.
5.  **Influence & Trend Analysis:** Identifying factors shaping user decisions and future needs.
6.  **Opportunity & Feature Strategy:** Translating insights into actionable product opportunities.

### Data Sources

This report is based on the provided `proposal.md`, a detailed persona analysis, and a structured brainstorming and research process facilitated by the BMad Business Analyst agent. Actual user interviews and surveys would be the next step for empirical validation.

---

## 2. User Overview

### User Context

*   **Primary Category:** Job Application Assistance / Career Development Tools.
*   **Adjacent Markets:** AI Writing Assistants, Resume Builders, Job Boards, Educational Technology (EdTech). Our user research will primarily focus on the core category but keep adjacent areas in mind for potential user overlap.

### User Value and Impact Summary

*   **Time Savings:** Emily could save 45 minutes to 1.5 hours per application.
*   **Increased Confidence:** Emily will feel significantly more confident in her applications.
*   **Reduced Stress/Anxiety:** The burden of manual tailoring and ATS worries will be substantially alleviated.
*   **Improved Quality:** Higher relevance, ATS optimization, and better articulation in documents.

### Key User Research Questions

The following refined questions were developed to guide future user interviews or surveys:

**A. Understanding Current Experiences & Pain Points:**
1.  "Walk me through your typical process for tailoring your CV and cover letter for a specific job application. What are the biggest challenges or frustrations you encounter?"
2.  "What tools or resources (online or offline) do you currently use to help with job applications, and what do you like or dislike about them?"

**B. Expectations & Feature Validation:**
3.  "What are your key expectations for an AI-powered tool designed to assist with CV and cover letter tailoring?"
4.  "Regarding document upload, how important is it for you to be able to upload your CV in various formats (PDF, DOC, TXT) and paste job ad text directly? What would make this process easiest for you?"
5.  "When receiving suggestions for improving your CV, what specific types of feedback would you find most valuable and actionable?"
6.  "For an AI-generated cover letter, what tone and style would you typically prefer, and why is that important to you?"

**C. User Journey & Context:**
7.  "Describe your overall job application journey, from finding a job to submitting the application. At what points in this journey do you envision using an AI assistant like this?"
8.  "What devices do you primarily use when working on job applications, and how might that influence your use of an AI assistant?"

**D. Unmet Needs & Desires:**
9.  "Beyond what we've discussed, what's one significant challenge you face in job applications that you wish an AI tool could solve?"
10. "If this AI assistant could deliver one ultimate benefit to you, what would it be?"

---

## 3. User Trends and Influences

### Key User Trends

*   **Increased AI in Recruitment:** Users are aware that AI is used by recruiters, driving a need for AI-optimized applications.
*   **Skills-Based Hiring:** Emphasis on demonstrable skills means users need help articulating their competencies effectively.
*   **Demand for Transparency & Feedback:** Users expect more clarity in hiring processes and crave constructive feedback.
*   **Personal Branding:** Importance of a strong online professional presence.

### User Motivations and Needs

*   **Efficiency:** Saving time in the application process.
*   **Confidence:** Feeling prepared and optimized for each application.
*   **Clarity:** Understanding what recruiters are looking for.
*   **Control:** Maintaining agency over their job search.

### User Pain Points and Anxieties

*   Time-consuming manual tailoring.
*   Uncertainty about application effectiveness (ATS anxiety).
*   Lack of specific feedback on rejections.
*   Writer's block for cover letters.

### Future User Needs and Opportunities

*   Agility and adaptability in a dynamic job market.
*   Tools that help navigate global competition.
*   Ethical AI and data privacy assurances.

---

## 4. User Persona Analysis

### Target Customer Segments

*   **The Proactive Student:** Seeking internships or first full-time roles, limited professional experience.
*   **The Recent Graduate (Entry-Level Seeker):** (Primary Focus) 0-1 year out, new to full-time job market.
*   **The Early Career Professional (Transitioner):** 1-3 years experience, seeking advancement or career change.

### Persona: Emily, The Ambitious Graduate

*   **Demographics:** Age 22-24, recently completed Bachelor's, high tech-savvy.
*   **Goals:** Secure entry-level role, start career, stand out, learn effective presentation.
*   **Pain Points:** Time-consuming tailoring, uncertainty about relevance, ATS anxiety, lack of feedback, writer's block.
*   **Motivations:** Career growth, financial independence, making contribution, efficiency.
*   **Interaction:** Uploads CV/job ad, uses AI for cover letter drafts, seeks CV improvement suggestions, values quick actionable feedback, tracks applications.

### Jobs-to-be-Done Analysis

**Functional Jobs:**
*   "Get my CV and cover letter tailored quickly and effectively for each specific job application."
*   "Ensure my application documents highlight my most relevant skills and experiences for the job."
*   "Pass Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) with my CV."
*   "Articulate my value proposition clearly and concisely in a cover letter."
*   "Organize and track my job applications efficiently."
*   "Understand what specific improvements I need to make to my CV to match job requirements."

**Emotional Jobs:**
*   "Feel confident and prepared when submitting a job application."
*   "Reduce the stress and overwhelm associated with the job search process."
*   "Feel like I'm doing everything I can to maximize my chances of getting a job."
*   "Feel in control of my job search, rather than it controlling me."
*   "Feel a sense of accomplishment after submitting a high-quality application."

**Social Jobs:**
*   "Be perceived as a professional and highly competent candidate by recruiters and hiring managers."
*   "Impress potential employers with a polished and well-crafted application."
*   "Avoid embarrassment or appearing unprepared when discussing my job search."
*   "Be seen as proactive and resourceful in my job search efforts."

### Pricing Analysis and Willingness to Pay

*   **Current Spending:** Low, primarily time and effort.
*   **Budget:** Constrained, highly price-sensitive.
*   **Value Perception:** High for time-saving, confidence-boosting, and success-improving features.
*   **Conclusion:** Willing to pay a small, recurring monthly fee (e.g., $5-$15 USD) for clear value; freemium model attractive.

---

## 5. User's Alternatives and Perceptions

### User's Current Solutions and Alternatives

*   **Manual Customization (Word/Google Docs):** Pros: Full control. Cons: Time-consuming, error-prone, uncertain effectiveness.
*   **Free Online Resume Builders/Templates:** Pros: Easy start, professional templates. Cons: Limited customization, generic, not always ATS-friendly.
*   **University Career Services:** Pros: Free, personalized advice, trusted. Cons: Limited availability, generic advice, slow feedback.
*   **Generic AI Writing Tools (ChatGPT, Grammarly):** Pros: Helps with phrasing, quick text generation. Cons: Not job-application specific, lacks context.
*   **Job Boards with "Easy Apply":** Pros: Convenient, quick. Cons: Generic applications, low success rate.

### Gaps and Opportunities for the AI Assistant

*   **Integrated & Context-Aware Solution:** No single tool combines all necessary functionalities seamlessly.
*   **Actionable & Specific Feedback:** Existing tools lack specific, actionable advice tied to the job.
*   **Genuine Time-Saving Automation:** A significant gap in intelligent automation that maintains quality and personalization.
*   **Confidence Building:** Alternatives don't effectively address the emotional job of building confidence and reducing anxiety.

---

## 6. User Influences

### Emily's Influences and Decision Factors

*   **Peer and Social Norms:** Influenced by peers' job search experiences and social media advice.
*   **Recruiters and Employers:** Driven by the perceived need for ATS optimization and tailored applications; frustrated by lack of feedback.
*   **Personal Motivations:** Strong desire for success, fear of rejection, need for efficiency.
*   **Economic Realities:** Competitive job market and financial pressure to secure employment quickly.

### User Adoption Considerations

*   **Trust:** Will users trust the AI's suggestions and outputs?
*   **Ease of Use:** Must be significantly easier and faster than current alternatives.
*   **Perceived Value:** Must clearly demonstrate time savings and increased application effectiveness.

### User Journey Touchpoints

The AI assistant integrates at critical points in Emily's job application journey:
*   After finding a job opening (for tailoring).
*   During CV and cover letter creation/refinement.
*   Before submission (for final review and confidence boost).
*   After submission (for tracking).

---

## 7. User-Centric Opportunities

### Identified Opportunities

1.  **Hyper-Personalized Application Generation:** AI learns user style to generate more authentic documents.
2.  **Proactive Skill Gap Identification & Targeted Learning Recommendations:** AI identifies gaps and suggests specific learning resources.
3.  **Integrated Application Management & Insights:** Provides simple analytics and tracking for applications.
4.  **Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts:** Generates common interview questions based on job ad and CV.

### Opportunity Prioritization (Quick Wins)

1.  **Enhanced Document Upload:** Dedicated drag-and-drop zones with clear feedback.
2.  **Cover Letter Style Presets:** Curated tone and style options for generation.
3.  **Categorized CV Suggestions:** Organized and presented feedback for improvements.
4.  **Application Tracking Tags:** Simple tagging for saved job applications.

---

## 8. Feature Strategy Recommendations

### Go-to-Market Strategy

*   **Positioning Strategy:** Position the AI assistant as Emily's "Personal Career Co-pilot" â€“ empowering, time-saving, and confidence-boosting.
*   **Target Segment Focus:** Prioritize "The Recent Graduate" (Emily) for initial development.
*   **Channel Strategy:** Focus on digital channels where Emily seeks job advice (career forums, university partnerships, social media).
*   **Pricing Strategy:** Recommend a freemium or low-cost subscription model.

### Implementation Roadmap (High-Level)

*   **Phase 1 (MVP):** Focus on "Quick Wins" and core "Must Have" features from `proposal.md`.
*   **Phase 2 (Enhancements):** Implement "Promising Concepts" and more advanced features identified in opportunities.
*   **Phase 3 (Future):** Explore "Bold Moonshots" and deeper integrations.

---

## 9. User-Centric Risk Assessment

### Risk Analysis

*   **Trust & Transparency Risks:** User distrust of AI-generated content, potential for bias.
*   **Data Privacy Risks:** Concerns about personal data storage and usage.
*   **Over-reliance Risk:** Users becoming overly dependent on the AI.

### Mitigation Strategies

*   **Transparency:** Clear explanations of AI functionality, manual override options, emphasis on human review.
*   **Security:** Robust security measures, clear privacy policy, user control over data.
*   **Empowerment:** Design AI as an assistant, not a replacement; encourage review, personalization, and skill development.

---

## 10. User Value and Impact Assessment

*   **Time Savings:** 45 minutes to 1.5 hours per application.
*   **Confidence & Stress Reduction:** Significantly increased confidence, reduced anxiety.
*   **Improved Application Quality:** Higher relevance, ATS optimization, better articulation.
*   **Learning & Skill Development:** Users learn best practices and identify skill gaps.

---

## Appendices

### Appendix A: Data Sources and References

*   `proposal.md` for "AI CV & Job Application Assistant"
*   Brainstorming session with BIP (2025-10-29)
*   Persona analysis and Jobs-to-be-Done framework application.

### Appendix B: Detailed User Research Questions

(See "Key User Research Questions" in Section 2. User Overview)

### Appendix C: Additional User Segments

*   **The Proactive Student:** Currently enrolled, seeking internships/first roles.
*   **The Early Career Professional (Transitioner):** 1-3 years experience, seeking advancement or career change.

### Appendix D: Glossary of Terms

*   **ATS (Applicant Tracking System):** Software used by recruiters to manage and screen job applications.
*   **JTBD (Jobs-to-be-Done):** A framework for understanding what customers are trying to achieve.
*   **Persona:** A fictional character representing a type of user.

## Case Title
AI CV & Job Application Assistant

## Background
Students often struggle to tailor their CVs and cover letters for each specific job application, a crucial step for success in a competitive job market. This process is time-consuming and requires a good understanding of how to highlight relevant skills. An AI-powered tool can automate and optimize this process, providing a realistic experience of how AI is used in modern recruitment.

## Purpose
The primary purpose of this application is to help students create customized, high-quality job applications. It will analyze a user's CV against a specific job advertisement to generate a tailored cover letter, suggest improvements to the CV, and identify any missing qualifications.

## Target Users
The main target users are students and recent graduates who are actively applying for jobs and need assistance in creating compelling application documents.

## Core Functionality
The core features are focused on analyzing user documents and generating optimized application materials.

### Must Have (MVP)
- Feature 1: Document Upload: Users can upload their CV in various formats (PDF, DOC, TXT) and paste the text of a job advertisement.
- Feature 2: Cover Letter Generation: The system generates a customized cover letter based on the user's CV and the job description, allowing the user to specify a desired tone and style.
- Feature 3: CV Improvement Suggestions: The application analyzes the CV and provides concrete suggestions for improvements to better match the job requirements.

### Nice to Have (Optional Extensions)
- Feature 4: Gap Analysis: The tool provides a detailed analysis of missing qualifications and skills (a "gap analysis") by comparing the CV to the job ad.
- Feature 5: ATS Optimization Score: The system gives feedback on how well the CV is optimized for Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and suggests keyword improvements.
- Feature 6: Multi-language Support: Ability to process documents and generate outputs in different languages.

## Data Requirements
The system needs to manage user-specific information and the documents they upload and generate.

- Data entity 1: Users: User ID, email, encrypted password, and other profile information.
- Data entity 2: CVs/Documents: Storage for uploaded documents like CVs and past applications, linked to a specific user. Encrypted storage is required.
- Data entity 3: Job Applications: Data related to each application session, including the pasted job ad, user inputs (keywords, tone), and the generated documents (cover letter, analysis reports).

## User Stories (Optional)

1. As a student, I want to upload my CV and a job ad, so that I can get a tailored cover letter automatically.
2. As a job applicant, I want to receive suggestions on how to improve my CV, so that it better matches the job I'm applying for.
3. As a user, I want to create a secure account, so that I can save my documents and track my applications over time.

## Technical Constraints
The project has specific technical and security requirements.

- User Authentication: A secure login system is mandatory to protect personal data and documents.
- Responsive design: The application must be responsive to work on PC. mobiles and tablets, as many users probably is using their mobile device.
- File Handling: The application must be able to process different file formats for CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT).

## Success Criteria
The success of the project will be measured by its core functionalities.

- Criterion 1: Successful Document Generation: Users can successfully upload their CV and a job description and receive a relevant, well-written cover letter.
- Criterion 2: Actionable Feedback: The CV improvement suggestions are clear, relevant, and helpful to the user.
- Criterion 3: Secure User Sessions: User data is securely stored, and users can log in to access their previous sessions and documents.
--- End of content ---

The core features are focused on analyzing user documents and generating optimized application materials.

### Must Have (MVP)
- Feature 1: Enhanced Document Upload: Users can upload their CV in various formats (PDF, DOC, TXT) and paste the text of a job advertisement. This includes dedicated drag-and-drop zones with clear feedback for intuitive UX.
- Feature 2: Cover Letter Generation: The system generates a customized cover letter based on the user's CV and the job description, allowing the user to specify a desired tone and style using curated style presets.
- Feature 3: Categorized CV Improvement Suggestions: The application analyzes the CV and provides concrete, categorized suggestions for improvements to better match the job requirements, presented in an organized and actionable format.

### Nice to Have (Optional Extensions)
- Feature 4: Gap Analysis: The tool provides a detailed analysis of missing qualifications and skills (a "gap analysis") by comparing the CV to the job ad.
- Feature 5: ATS Optimization Score: The system gives feedback on how well the CV is optimized for Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and suggests keyword improvements.
- Feature 6: Multi-language Support: Ability to process documents and generate outputs in different languages.

## User-Centric Opportunities (Future Enhancements)
Based on user research, the following opportunities are identified for future enhancements to further empower users:

- **Hyper-Personalized Application Generation:** AI learns user style and preferences to generate even more authentic and personalized application documents.
- **Proactive Skill Gap Identification & Targeted Learning Recommendations:** The AI identifies skill gaps based on desired roles and suggests specific learning resources or courses.
- **Integrated Application Management & Insights:** Provides simple analytics and tracking for applications, offering users insights into their job search effectiveness.
- **Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts:** Generates common interview questions based on the job ad and the user's CV, aiding in interview preparation.

## Data Requirements
The system needs to manage user-specific information and the documents they upload and generate.

- Data entity 1: Users: User ID, email, encrypted password, and other profile information.
- Data entity 2: CVs/Documents: Storage for uploaded documents like CVs and past applications, linked to a specific user. Encrypted storage is required.
- Data entity 3: Job Applications: Data related to each application session, including the pasted job ad, user inputs (keywords, tone), and the generated documents (cover letter, analysis reports).

## User Stories (Optional)

1. As a student, I want to upload my CV and a job ad, so that I can get a tailored cover letter automatically.
2. As a job applicant, I want to receive suggestions on how to improve my CV, so that it better matches the job I'm applying for.
3. As a user, I want to create a secure account, so that I can save my documents and track my applications over time.

## Technical Constraints
The project has specific technical and security requirements.

- User Authentication: A secure login system is mandatory to protect personal data and documents.
- Responsive design: The application must be responsive to work on PC. mobiles and tablets, as many users probably is using their mobile device.
- File Handling: The application must be able to process different file formats for CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT).

## Success Criteria
The success of the project will be measured by its core functionalities and user impact.

- Criterion 1: Successful Document Generation: Users can successfully upload their CV and a job description and receive a relevant, well-written cover letter, demonstrating high relevance and quality.
- Criterion 2: Actionable Feedback: The CV improvement suggestions are clear, relevant, helpful, and easily actionable by the user, leading to measurable improvements in application quality.
- Criterion 3: Secure and Intuitive User Experience: User data is securely stored, and users can log in to access their previous sessions and documents with an intuitive and transparent interface that builds trust.
- Criterion 4: Time Savings & Confidence Boost: The tool demonstrably saves users significant time per application and increases their confidence in the application process.

# Product Brief: ibe160

**Date:** 2025-10-29
**Author:** BIP
**Status:** Draft for PM Review

---

## Executive Summary

{{executive_summary}}

---

## Problem Statement

Students and recent graduates frequently struggle with the time-consuming, tedious, and anxiety-inducing process of tailoring their CVs and cover letters for each job application. This manual effort makes it difficult to consistently highlight relevant skills and effectively navigate Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), creating a significant barrier to success in a competitive job market.

---

## Proposed Solution

An AI-powered "CV & Job Application Assistant" that automates and optimizes the application process. The tool will analyze a user's CV against a specific job advertisement to:
1.  **Generate a tailored cover letter** with a user-specified tone and style.
2.  **Provide categorized, actionable suggestions** for improving the CV to better match the job requirements.
3.  **Offer an intuitive document upload experience** to streamline the process.

This solution will empower users to create high-quality, customized applications with significant time savings and increased confidence.

---

## Target Users

### Primary User Segment

Students and recent graduates (0-3 years post-graduation) actively seeking entry-level or early-career professional roles. Our core persona is **Emily, The Ambitious Graduate** (age 22-24, high tech-savvy), who is motivated to secure her first full-time role and stand out in a competitive market.

### Secondary User Segment

Early career professionals (1-3 years experience) seeking to transition to a new role or industry and looking for tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their job search.

---

## Goals and Success Metrics

### Business Objectives

-   Successfully launch the MVP of the AI CV & Job Application Assistant.
-   Achieve a high level of user satisfaction and engagement.
-   Establish a foundation for future enhancements and monetization.

### User Success Metrics

-   **Time Savings:** Users save a significant amount of time (target: >30 minutes) per application.
-   **Increased Confidence:** Users report a measurable increase in confidence in their job applications.
-   **Improved Application Quality:** Users can create higher quality, more relevant application documents.

### Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

-   Number of active users.
-   Number of applications processed.
-   User satisfaction score (e.g., NPS or CSAT).
-   Adoption rate of core features (cover letter generation, CV suggestions).

---

## Strategic Alignment and Financial Impact

### Financial Impact

{{financial_impact}}

### Company Objectives Alignment

{{company_objectives_alignment}}

### Strategic Initiatives

{{strategic_initiatives}}

---

## MVP Scope

### Core Features (Must Have)

-   **Enhanced Document Upload:** Intuitive drag-and-drop interface for uploading CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT) and pasting job ad text.
-   **Cover Letter Generation:** AI-powered generation of tailored cover letters with curated style presets.
-   **Categorized CV Improvement Suggestions:** Actionable, organized feedback to help users improve their CVs for specific jobs.

### Out of Scope for MVP

-   Gap Analysis (detailed analysis of missing qualifications).
-   ATS Optimization Score.
-   Multi-language Support.
-   Hyper-Personalized Application Generation.
-   Proactive Skill Gap Identification.
-   Integrated Application Management & Insights.
-   Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts.

### MVP Success Criteria

-   Users can successfully generate a relevant and high-quality cover letter.
-   The CV improvement suggestions are clear, helpful, and actionable.
-   The user interface is intuitive and builds user trust.
-   The system securely handles user data and sessions.

---

## Post-MVP Vision

### Phase 2 Features

-   **Gap Analysis:** Detailed analysis of missing qualifications and skills.
-   **ATS Optimization Score:** Feedback on how well the CV is optimized for Applicant Tracking Systems.
-   **Multi-language Support:** Ability to process documents and generate outputs in different languages.
-   **Integrated Application Management & Insights:** Simple analytics and tracking for applications.

### Long-term Vision

-   **Hyper-Personalized Application Generation:** An AI that learns user style and preferences to generate more authentic documents.
-   **Proactive Skill Gap Identification & Targeted Learning Recommendations:** An AI that identifies skill gaps and suggests learning resources.
-   **Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts:** AI-generated interview questions based on the job ad and CV.

### Expansion Opportunities

-   Integrations with job boards and professional networking platforms.
-   Partnerships with universities and career services organizations.
-   Development of a B2B offering for recruitment agencies or HR departments.

---

## Technical Considerations

### Platform Requirements

-   The application must be a responsive web application, accessible on PC, mobile, and tablet devices.

### Technology Preferences

-   A secure login system is mandatory to protect user data.
-   The backend must be capable of processing different file formats for CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT).
-   The AI model for text generation and analysis should be chosen for its accuracy and efficiency.

### Architecture Considerations

-   A scalable architecture is required to handle a growing number of users and documents.
-   Data storage for user information and documents must be encrypted and secure.
-   The application should be designed for high availability and reliability.

---

## Constraints and Assumptions

### Constraints

{{constraints}}

### Key Assumptions

{{key_assumptions}}

---

## Risks and Open Questions

### Key Risks

{{key_risks}}

### Open Questions

{{open_questions}}

### Areas Needing Further Research

{{research_areas}}

---

## Appendices

### A. Research Summary

{{research_summary}}

### B. Stakeholder Input

{{stakeholder_input}}

### C. References

{{references}}

---

args.new_string:
# Product Brief: ibe160

**Date:** 2025-10-29
**Author:** BIP
**Status:** Draft for PM Review

---

## Executive Summary

The "AI CV & Job Application Assistant" is a tool designed to empower students and recent graduates in the competitive job market. By automating the tedious process of tailoring CVs and cover letters, the application saves users significant time, boosts their confidence, and improves the quality of their job applications. The MVP will focus on core features like cover letter generation and CV improvement suggestions, with a long-term vision to become a comprehensive career co-pilot.

---

## Problem Statement

Students and recent graduates frequently struggle with the time-consuming, tedious, and anxiety-inducing process of tailoring their CVs and cover letters for each job application. This manual effort makes it difficult to consistently highlight relevant skills and effectively navigate Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), creating a significant barrier to success in a competitive job market.

---

## Proposed Solution

An AI-powered "CV & Job Application Assistant" that automates and optimizes the application process. The tool will analyze a user's CV against a specific job advertisement to:
1.  **Generate a tailored cover letter** with a user-specified tone and style.
2.  **Provide categorized, actionable suggestions** for improving the CV to better match the job requirements.
3.  **Offer an intuitive document upload experience** to streamline the process.

This solution will empower users to create high-quality, customized applications with significant time savings and increased confidence.

---

## Target Users

### Primary User Segment

Students and recent graduates (0-3 years post-graduation) actively seeking entry-level or early-career professional roles. Our core persona is **Emily, The Ambitious Graduate** (age 22-24, high tech-savvy), who is motivated to secure her first full-time role and stand out in a competitive market.

### Secondary User Segment

Early career professionals (1-3 years experience) seeking to transition to a new role or industry and looking for tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their job search.

---

## Goals and Success Metrics

### Business Objectives

-   Successfully launch the MVP of the AI CV & Job Application Assistant.
-   Achieve a high level of user satisfaction and engagement.
-   Establish a foundation for future enhancements and monetization.

### User Success Metrics

-   **Time Savings:** Users save a significant amount of time (target: >30 minutes) per application.
-   **Increased Confidence:** Users report a measurable increase in confidence in their job applications.
-   **Improved Application Quality:** Users can create higher quality, more relevant application documents.

### Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

-   Number of active users.
-   Number of applications processed.
-   User satisfaction score (e.g., NPS or CSAT).
-   Adoption rate of core features (cover letter generation, CV suggestions).

---

## Strategic Alignment and Financial Impact

### Financial Impact

The project is expected to have a positive financial impact through a future subscription-based model. The initial focus is on user acquisition and engagement.

### Company Objectives Alignment

This project aligns with the company's objective of leveraging AI to create innovative solutions that address real-world user needs.

### Strategic Initiatives

This project supports the strategic initiative of expanding into the EdTech and career development market.

---

## MVP Scope

### Core Features (Must Have)

-   **Enhanced Document Upload:** Intuitive drag-and-drop interface for uploading CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT) and pasting job ad text.
-   **Cover Letter Generation:** AI-powered generation of tailored cover letters with curated style presets.
-   **Categorized CV Improvement Suggestions:** Actionable, organized feedback to help users improve their CVs for specific jobs.

### Out of Scope for MVP

-   Gap Analysis (detailed analysis of missing qualifications).
-   ATS Optimization Score.
-   Multi-language Support.
-   Hyper-Personalized Application Generation.
-   Proactive Skill Gap Identification.
-   Integrated Application Management & Insights.
-   Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts.

### MVP Success Criteria

-   Users can successfully generate a relevant and high-quality cover letter.
-   The CV improvement suggestions are clear, helpful, and actionable.
-   The user interface is intuitive and builds user trust.
-   The system securely handles user data and sessions.

---

## Post-MVP Vision

### Phase 2 Features

-   **Gap Analysis:** Detailed analysis of missing qualifications and skills.
-   **ATS Optimization Score:** Feedback on how well the CV is optimized for Applicant Tracking Systems.
-   **Multi-language Support:** Ability to process documents and generate outputs in different languages.
-   **Integrated Application Management & Insights:** Simple analytics and tracking for applications.

### Long-term Vision

-   **Hyper-Personalized Application Generation:** An AI that learns user style and preferences to generate more authentic documents.
-   **Proactive Skill Gap Identification & Targeted Learning Recommendations:** An AI that identifies skill gaps and suggests learning resources.
-   **Simplified Interview Preparation Prompts:** AI-generated interview questions based on the job ad and CV.

### Expansion Opportunities

-   Integrations with job boards and professional networking platforms.
-   Partnerships with universities and career services organizations.
-   Development of a B2B offering for recruitment agencies or HR departments.

---

## Technical Considerations

### Platform Requirements

-   The application must be a responsive web application, accessible on PC, mobile, and tablet devices.

### Technology Preferences

-   A secure login system is mandatory to protect user data.
-   The backend must be capable of processing different file formats for CVs (PDF, DOC, TXT).
-   The AI model for text generation and analysis should be chosen for its accuracy and efficiency.

### Architecture Considerations

-   A scalable architecture is required to handle a growing number of users and documents.
-   Data storage for user information and documents must be encrypted and secure.
-   The application should be designed for high availability and reliability.

---

## Constraints and Assumptions

### Constraints

-   The application must be responsive and work on PC, mobile, and tablets.
-   A secure login system is mandatory.
-   The system must handle PDF, DOC, and TXT file formats.

### Key Assumptions

-   Users are willing to use an AI-powered tool for their job applications.
-   Users will provide accurate and up-to-date information in their CVs.
-   The chosen AI model will be able to provide high-quality and relevant outputs.

---

## Risks and Open Questions

### Key Risks

-   **Trust & Transparency:** Users may distrust AI-generated content. Mitigation: Provide clear explanations of AI functionality and allow for manual overrides.
-   **Data Privacy:** Users may have concerns about the storage and usage of their personal data. Mitigation: Implement robust security measures and a clear privacy policy.
-   **Over-reliance:** Users may become overly dependent on the AI. Mitigation: Position the tool as an assistant and encourage user review and personalization.

### Open Questions

-   What is the most effective pricing model for this product (freemium vs. subscription)?
-   How can we best measure the impact of the tool on user success in the job market?
-   What are the most important factors for building user trust in an AI-powered career tool?

### Areas Needing Further Research

-   Empirical validation of the feature impact through user testing and surveys.
-   A/B testing of different UI/UX approaches to maximize usability and trust.
-   Exploration of different AI models for text generation and analysis.

---

## Appendices

### A. Research Summary

The user research report ("research-user-2025-10-29.md") provides a detailed analysis of the target user, their pain points, and the market opportunity.

### B. Stakeholder Input

This brief is based on the initial project proposal ("proposal.md") and subsequent discussions.

### C. References

-   proposal.md
-   docs/research-user-2025-10-29.md

---

_This Product Brief serves as the foundational input for Product Requirements Document (PRD) creation._

_Next Steps: Handoff to Product Manager for PRD development using the `workflow prd` command._

# PRD Workflow Instructions

<critical>The workflow execution engine is governed by: {project-root}/bmad/core/tasks/workflow.xml</critical>
<critical>You MUST have already loaded and processed: {installed_path}/workflow.yaml</critical>

PRD is for Level 2-4 projects. Level 0-1 should use tech-spec directly.

**Correct workflow:** `tech-spec` (Architect agent)
</output>
<action>Exit and redirect to tech-spec</action>
</check>

  <check if="prd status is file path (already completed)">
    <output>âš ï¸ PRD already completed: {{prd status}}</output>
    <ask>Re-running will overwrite the existing PRD. Continue? (y/n)</ask>
    <check if="n">
      <output>Exiting. Use workflow-status to see your next step.</output>
      <action>Exit workflow</action>
    </check>
  </check>

  <check if="prd is not the next expected workflow">
    <output>âš ï¸ Next expected workflow: {{next_workflow}}. PRD is out of sequence.</output>
    <ask>Continue with PRD anyway? (y/n)</ask>
    <check if="n">
      <output>Exiting. Run {{next_workflow}} instead.</output>
      <action>Exit workflow</action>
    </check>
  </check>

<action>Set standalone_mode = false</action>
</check>
</step>

<step n="1" goal="Initialize PRD context">

<action>Use {{project_level}} from status data</action>
<action>Check for existing PRD.md in {output_folder}</action>

<check if="PRD.md exists">
  <ask>Found existing PRD.md. Would you like to:
1. Continue where you left off
2. Modify existing sections
3. Start fresh (will archive existing file)
  </ask>
  <action if="option 1">Load existing PRD and skip to first incomplete section</action>
  <action if="option 2">Load PRD and ask which section to modify</action>
  <action if="option 3">Archive existing PRD and start fresh</action>
</check>

<action>Load PRD template: {prd_template}</action>
<action>Load epics template: {epics_template}</action>

<ask>Do you have a Product Brief? (Strongly recommended for Level 3-4, helpful for Level 2)</ask>
